attributes.description: Defines the key-value pairs used for matching requests to the sampling rule, such as HTTP method, URL path, or service name. Constraints depend on the rule's intended purpose.

aws_xray_sampling_rule_version.description: Defines the version of the sampling rule, typically set to 1 for the current API.

fixed_rate.description: Defines the percentage of matching requests to be sampled, expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1.

host.description: Specifies the hostname or IP address that the sampling rule applies to, supporting patterns and wildcards.

http_method.description: Specifies the HTTP method for requests to match, such as GET, POST, or DELETE.

priority.description: Determines the order in which sampling rules are evaluated, with lower values being given higher precedence. Must be an integer between 1 and 1000.

reservoir_size.description: Defines the maximum number of requests per second to sample, setting the reservoir size for the sampling rule.

resource_arn.description: Defines the ARN of the resource associated with the sampling rule, such as a service or application. Must be a valid AWS ARN.

rule_name.description: Name of the sampling rule to be applied for tracing requests. Must be unique within the AWS account.

service_name.description: Specifies the name of the service to which the sampling rule applies, must be a non-empty string.

service_type.description: Specifies the type of service to match for the sampling rule, such as AWS::EC2::Instance or AWS::ElasticBeanstalk::Environment.

tags.description: Key-value pairs to assign to the sampling rule for identification and organization; supports tagging for cost allocation and resource management.

url_path.description: Defines the URL path used for matching incoming requests to the sampling rule; must follow the pattern of a valid URL path.
